intro: Rubus diffissus, commonly known as the rough blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Botanically, it is part of the Rosaceae family and is closely related to other Rubus species.
